title: Numbers Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Numbers with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 36 chapters.

questions.question: Who was appointed by God to help Moses in the numbering of the children of Israel?
questions.explanation: Moses and Aaron were commanded to number the children of Israel by their armies.

questions.question: What was the minimum age for males to be counted in the census for war?
questions.explanation: Only males from twenty years old and upward, able to go forth to war, were numbered.

questions.question: Which tribe's prince was Nahshon, son of Amminadab?
questions.explanation: Nahshon, son of Amminadab, was the prince of the tribe of Judah.

questions.question: How many men were numbered from the tribe of Reuben?
questions.explanation: The number of men from the tribe of Reuben was forty-six thousand five hundred.

questions.question: True or False: The Levites were included in the census for war among the tribes of Israel.
questions.explanation: The Levites were not counted among those numbered for war.

questions.question: What was the special responsibility of the tribe of Levi?
options: To be rulers over the tribes
questions.explanation: The Levites were set apart to take care of the tabernacle and all its instruments.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And the LORD spake unto Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the tabernacle of the congregation, on the first day of the _____ month, in the second year after they were come out of the land of Egypt.'
questions.explanation: The census was taken on the first day of the second month in the second year after the Exodus.

questions.question: True or False: The children of Israel kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month in the wilderness.
questions.explanation: They kept the Passover according to the LORD's command on the fourteenth day of the first month.

questions.question: What provision was made for those who were unclean by touching a dead body and could not keep the Passover at the appointed time?
options: They were excused and did not have to keep it
They would keep it at the fourteenth day of the second month
They could keep it anytime in the year
They had to offer a sin offering instead
questions.correctAnswer: They would keep it at the fourteenth day of the second month
questions.explanation: God commanded that those unclean or on a journey keep the Passover at the appointed time in the second month.

questions.question: True or False: The cloud that covered the tabernacle appeared only by day.
questions.explanation: The cloud covered the tabernacle by day and appeared as fire by night.

questions.question: How did the Israelites know when to journey or stay camped during their wilderness journey?
options: By the position of the sun
When the cloud lifted from the tabernacle
By the word of the priests
questions.correctAnswer: When the cloud lifted from the tabernacle
questions.explanation: They journeyed when the cloud lifted from the tabernacle and stayed when it remained.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'Speak unto the children of Israel, and take of every one of them a _____ according to the house of their fathers.'
questions.explanation: God commanded Moses to take a rod from each prince of the tribes.

questions.question: Which man's rod budded, blossomed, and yielded almonds as a sign from God?
questions.explanation: The rod of Aaron budded and blossomed to show God's choice of him for the priesthood.

questions.question: True or False: The rods of all twelve princes were placed before the LORD in the tabernacle as a testimony.
questions.explanation: All twelve rods, including Aaron's, were laid up before the LORD in the tabernacle.

questions.question: What was God's purpose in making Aaron's rod bud?
options: To show His favor to the tribe of Levi
To silence the murmuring of the children of Israel
To indicate the start of the journey
questions.correctAnswer: To silence the murmuring of the children of Israel
questions.explanation: God intended the budding of Aaron's rod to stop the complaints against Moses and Aaron.

questions.question: True or False: Anyone who came near the tabernacle of the LORD without permission was subject to death.
questions.explanation: The Israelites feared death if they came near the tabernacle improperly.

questions.question: Where did the children of Israel begin to commit whoredom with the daughters of Moab?
questions.explanation: Israel stayed in Shittim where the people began to sin with Moabite women.

questions.question: True or False: The children of Israel joined themselves to the god Baal-peor.
questions.explanation: Israel joined themselves to Baal-peor, provoking the anger of the LORD.

questions.question: What action did God command Moses to do to turn away His fierce anger from Israel because of their sin with Baal-peor?
options: Hang the heads of the people before the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Hang the heads of the people before the LORD
questions.explanation: God told Moses to hang the heads of the offenders before the LORD against the sun.

questions.question: Who was instructed to slay every man that was joined to Baal-peor?
questions.explanation: Moses commanded the judges to execute judgment on those joined to Baal-peor.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'And the LORD said unto Moses, Take all the _____ of the people, and hang them up before the LORD against the sun.'
questions.explanation: God commanded hanging the heads of the people to turn away His anger.

questions.question: True or False: The Levites were numbered separately from the other tribes because they were given the responsibility of the tabernacle.
questions.explanation: The Levites were set apart for service in the tabernacle and were not counted with the fighting men.

questions.question: What was the total number of men able to go to war from the tribe of Judah?
questions.explanation: The number of men from Judah was seventy-four thousand six hundred.

questions.question: True or False: The cloud that covered the tabernacle sometimes tarried for a month or more, and the Israelites stayed in their tents until it lifted.
questions.explanation: The cloud could remain for long periods, and the people stayed camped as commanded.

questions.question: Who was the son of Gamaliel, prince of the tribe of Manasseh?
questions.explanation: Gamaliel son of Pedahzur was the prince of the tribe of Manasseh.

questions.question: True or False: Moses wrote every man's name on his rod for the test of the budding rods.
questions.explanation: Moses was instructed to write every man's name on his rod for identification.

questions.question: Which tribe's prince was Shelumiel, son of Zurishaddai?
questions.explanation: Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai was prince of the tribe of Simeon.

questions.question: True or False: The men who were defiled by touching a dead body were allowed to keep the Passover on the usual day without exception.
questions.explanation: They were allowed to keep the Passover on the fourteenth day of the second month instead.

questions.question: What was the reaction of the children of Israel when they saw the rod of Aaron budded and blossomed?
questions.explanation: They said, 'Behold, we die, we perish, we all perish.'

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'And when the cloud was taken up from the tabernacle, then after that the children of Israel _____.'
questions.explanation: The Israelites journeyed whenever the cloud lifted from the tabernacle.

questions.question: Which tribe had 35,400 men able to go to war according to the census?
questions.explanation: Benjamin had thirty-five thousand four hundred men able to go to war.

questions.question: True or False: Moses commanded the judges of Israel to slay every man who joined himself to Baal-peor.
questions.explanation: Moses instructed the judges to execute judgment on those joined to Baal-peor.

questions.question: Who was the prince of the tribe of Dan?
questions.explanation: Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai was prince of the tribe of Dan.

questions.question: True or False: The children of Israel journeyed only when the cloud was taken up from the tabernacle, whether by day or by night.
questions.explanation: They journeyed whenever the cloud was taken up, regardless of time of day.

questions.question: Which tribe's prince was Pagiel, son of Ocran?
questions.explanation: Pagiel son of Ocran was prince of the tribe of Asher.

questions.question: True or False: The rod of Aaron was kept as a token against the rebels among the children of Israel.
questions.explanation: Aaron's rod was kept as a testimony against the murmurers.

questions.question: How many rods were taken from the princes of the tribes of Israel for the test of the budding rod?
questions.explanation: One rod was taken from each of the twelve tribal princes.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'If any man of you or of your posterity shall be unclean by reason of a dead body, or be in a journey afar off, yet he shall keep the _____ unto the LORD.'
questions.explanation: God allowed those unclean or traveling to keep the Passover later.

questions.question: True or False: The children of Israel murmured against Moses and Aaron because of the test involving the rods.
questions.explanation: The murmuring of Israel was the reason God chose to cause Aaron's rod to bud.

questions.question: Who was the prince of the tribe of Ephraim?
questions.explanation: Elishama son of Ammihud was the prince of Ephraim.

questions.question: True or False: The children of Israel bowed down and sacrificed to the gods of Moab, provoking God's anger.
questions.explanation: They bowed to the sacrifices of Moab's gods, which angered the LORD.

questions.question: How many men were numbered from the tribe of Issachar?
questions.explanation: Fifty-four thousand four hundred men were counted from Issachar.

questions.question: Which tribe had the prince named Abidan, son of Gideoni?
questions.explanation: Abidan son of Gideoni was the prince of the tribe of Benjamin.

questions.question: True or False: If a man was clean and not traveling but failed to keep the Passover, he would be cut off from his people.
questions.explanation: Moses said such a man would bear his sin and be cut off.

questions.question: What sign accompanied the cloud over the tabernacle by night?
questions.explanation: The cloud appeared as fire by night over the tabernacle.
